name: Warwick Ibah Luxury Villas & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the Warwick Ibah for a two day quick visit to Ubud. It sits on the side of a hill just outside the centre of Ubud approx 1 hour from Kuta.
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Jasmine Villa which is one of the villas which outlooks over the lovely green canopy and landscape. The room was very clean and lovely - the bathroom was absolutley huge and the villa had its own outdoor shower. It also had a verandah to sit and take in the views. It is walking distance to town centre (although like most places in Bali shuttle service is alway available). Please note - There are quite a few stairs especialy to get to some of the higher villas.....
reviews.title: One of the best places I have stayed at! Wonderful understated luxury.

reviews.text: I did ask to look at one of the villas they have with its own pool (just because i was nosey and you never know when you might win lotto lol !) -these are even higher up the hill and this was absolutley beautiful too with a fantastic pool to swim in whilst overlooking the trees.
reviews.title: wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Afternoon tea is served 4-6 and is served in your room or anywhere in the resort and included in the price. It is very lush and tropical and the gardens are really nice. It is not a huge resort, and is very tranquil. The staff are courteus and very helpful. Room service was good. There are no kettles in the room hot water is brought to you in a thermos when required - a kettle would have been nice though.
reviews.title: A little bit of a disappointment

reviews.text: Bathroom was huge i know i said that already but i had to say it again !!
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: He gave us the option of checking out the batik, silver and wood carving markets on the way to the hotel, we stopped at the batik only because my gf was getting carsick. Reflecting back, I would have preferred just to go directly to the hotel if my gf did not get sick. Even with the one stop, we checked into the Ibah on time 2 PM. Stress free check in. Beautiful Hotel. Well worth the money.
reviews.title: A place to return to again and again......

likes.liked: — The staff its service and management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Front Desk was extremely professional and helpful. Actually, the entire Ibah staff was great. They never waited around for a tip, although we always gave them (room service, drivers and cleaning staff) a tip every time. I hope that fellow guests tip the staff!
reviews.title: Fine hotel but...
Horrible - Do Not Go
reviews.text: My fiancee and I just had the worst experience with the staff at the Hotel. We made a reservation, never confirmed it, and decided not to stay there because we never heard back from them about availability. We then received harassing phone calls from the staff as to why we never showed up. They proceeded to charge our credit card for almost $300 dollars. I called the Manager and he yelled at me, would not listen to me, and then hung up! I have never been treated so rudely. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ibah for our honeymoon and loved it. The service was exceptional - very attentive without being intrusive and always with a smile. We stayed in a villa with pool initially - the outdoor shower and lush gardens were divine. The layout of the villa itself was a little odd - one large room with the bed raised up high on a split level. The stairs to get up there were wierd - really high so it felt more like climbing into bed. We stayed in one of the normal apartments however for the majority of the time and these were delightful. Fantastic balcony overlooking lush tropical forest with waterfalls crashing below. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and each villa secluded and private. We hardly saw anyone else the whole time we were there. The main pool and bar area was a highlight - to the degree that if we went back we wouldn't get a pool villa because we'd want to use the main pool. Frangipanis line the moss covered laneways and stairs between villas - a nice touch.
reviews.title: Impeccible Service - attention to detail

likes.liked: — the beautiful pool and bar area.
likes.disliked: — the wierd split level layout in the pool villa

aka: Warwick Ibah Luxury Villas Hotel Ubud
description: Warwick Ibah is a prime example of classic and up-to-date Balinese hospitality and style. Exteriors reflect traditional Bali, with thatched roofs and stone walls carved with exuberant sculptures, making it the perfect place to discover the culture and spirit of Bali. The resort is situated on Royal grounds handed down through generations, alongside Holy springs discovered by a Hindu priest over four hundred years ago.
